definition: variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
variant of 飄|飘[piao1]
to float
to anchor/touch at/to moor
lake/Taiwan pr. [bo2]

sentences.english: Migratory songs wing from my heart and seek their nests in your voice od love.
sentences.chinese: 飘泊的歌儿从我心中飞去在你爱的呼声里寻找窠巢。

sentences.english: Homes, is that this group of urban rover ultimate desire.
sentences.chinese: 家园，是这一群都市飘泊者的最终渴望。

sentences.english: I am a lonely fox wondering solely around.
The boat drifted on the lake.
Who knows to where that person had wandered?
sentences.chinese: 谁知道人面飘泊何处去？

sentences.english: He left for Rome again yesterday. He is usually a bird of passage.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天又去罗马了，他是一个飘泊不定的人。

sentences.english: End of the World traces a pot of rover Ruhou hard, you go after the wine warm memories of lean thinking.
sentences.chinese: 一壶飘泊浪迹天涯难入喉，你走之后酒暖回忆思念瘦。

sentences.english: Those who live in other places go back to their hometown for Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春节前夕，飘泊异乡的游子们都纷纷返归家园。

sentences.english: This AE86 was made by Masa Ito from Team Arai RC Drifters.
sentences.chinese: 这AE86是由玛莎伊藤由钢筋混凝土井队飘泊。

definition: to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
variant of 飄零|飘零[piao1 ling2]
to live abroad/to be traveling/traveler
variant of 漂流[piao1 liu2]
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
foreign land/a place far from home
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to travel far/distant wanderings
foreign land/away from one's native place
drifting aimlessly all over the place (idiom)
